item.title: VW Beatle 1977
item.description: My first car! I kinda miss it. That’s the car that my wife learned how to drive. And my first contact with mechanical breakdowns and understanding how things work.

item.title: Where do I take my cars
item.description: I’ve been taking my cars to Plimmerton Mortos for years. They are friendly, reliable and helpful. It changed ownership recently. For the better! Frank, Logan, and Roger are awesome lads and eager to help.

item.title: Changing Mahindra wheel bearings
item.description: I had to change both wheel bearings on the front of my Mahindra Pik Up as part of it’s 128k Service and WOF. Outer Wheel bearing - Part number: LM501349/10 - Specs Inner Wheel bearing - Part numbeR: 25590/20 - Specs My cost for the set was around 115.00 NZD against 240.00 from Mahindra.

item.title: HotWheels Firepit - My first welding project
item.description: This is a simple project to start with, and it’s quite cool. I’ve built this as a project part of a welding course that I did on WELTEC. I didn’t use it much at the end, it ended up all rusty and I threw it away.

item.title: My stretcher tent
item.description: I found it easy to setup, easy to pack down and really comfortable. It works really well for me. I’ve slept on it with my 6 years old kid with no problems as well.

item.title: Install winch behind Mahindra original bumper
item.description: Using scrap metal from a scrapyard and some welding. I’ve built a custom winch cradle and installed a winch in my Mahindra. Just some pictures for now… [Open Album](photoprism.jose.co.nz/library/albums/asnvx60luaz7kbo6/view).

item.title: My call to keep the internet public
item.description: TLDR: What I’m noticing is that it is getting harder and harder to get answers by searching in the internet. Let’s choose public groups and websites over closed groups behind a username and password My first car was a VW Beatle 1977.

item.title: My NAS setup using UNRAID
item.description: I’ve been using unraid.net/ on a second hand desktop as my personal NAS for a couple of years and I’ve been enjoying the experience so far. Some things that I have running (I might write about them in the future): Photoprism To keep all our personal photos Nextcloud using less and less, but still using it to sync some photo uploads form my wife’s phone Syncthing using to sync photos from my phone and to sync these notes between my server, phone and computer Nginx Proxy Manager to map my services to domains and manage let’s encrypt Cloudflared to access my server securely using cloudflare tunnel .

item.title: Building this website
item.description: I use Obsidian to take notes, and I’ve been taking notes for quite a while. I thought on sharing more of my projects and decided to grab some of my notes and publish it.
